articles.headline: In an Italian Village, a Mayor Walks Off the Wine and Everyone Joins In
articles.snippet: Luciano Fregonese, the mayor of a town in Italy known for Prosecco, started walking to counter the calories he consumed at social obligations. His jaunts have become a sensation.
articles.abstract: Luciano Fregonese, the mayor of a town in Italy known for Prosecco, started walking to counter the calories he consumed at social obligations. His jaunts have become a sensation.
articles.lead_paragraph: In a world that seems consumed by the trials of capitalism and the unyielding pressure to work, Robin Leach, the British television personality who died in 2018, noted one place that did it differently: In Italy, Mr. Leach said, they add work and life onto food and wine.

articles.headline: How the Olympics Break Athletes’ Bodies
articles.snippet: With years of fractures, surgeries, hardware and pain, Olympians can list their injuries as readily as their achievements.
articles.abstract: With years of fractures, surgeries, hardware and pain, Olympians can list their injuries as readily as their achievements.
articles.lead_paragraph: Mariana Pajón is one of the world’s most accomplished BMX riders, and she can quickly recount some of her career totals: 18 world championships, two Olympic gold medals in racing (in 2012 and 2016) and one silver, in Tokyo in 2021.

articles.headline: Bomb Smuggled Into Tehran Guesthouse Months Ago Killed Hamas Leader
articles.snippet: An explosive device hidden in a heavily guarded complex where Ismail Haniyeh was known to stay in Iran was what killed him, according to a Times investigation.
articles.abstract: An explosive device hidden in a heavily guarded complex where Ismail Haniyeh was known to stay in Iran was what killed him, according to a Times investigation.
articles.lead_paragraph: Follow our latest updates on the Middle East crisis here.
articles.byline: By Ronen Bergman, Mark Mazzetti and Farnaz Fassihi

articles.headline: Secret Service’s Tech Flaws Helped Gunman Evade Detection at Trump Rally
articles.snippet: Technologies that might have protected the former president failed because they were improperly deployed or because the Secret Service chose not to use them.
articles.abstract: Technologies that might have protected the former president failed because they were improperly deployed or because the Secret Service chose not to use them.
articles.lead_paragraph: After a week of oversights and failures, the officers protecting former President Donald J. Trump at a campaign rally in Butler, Pa., still had one last chance to get it right. The chance lasted about 30 seconds.
articles.byline: By Eric Lipton and David A. Fahrenthold
